intro: Eriogonum concinnum, commonly known as the pink curlcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is characterized by its soft, gray-green foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sagebrush steppe and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eriogonum concinnum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained conditions.
